text: Max is good guy. He is intresting and knows a lot, has a good sense of humor. With him I was the same as at my own home, he can make anybody happy. We didn't spend a lot of time together but I would like to meet him 100 times more. My home is opened for him in Belarus and Montenegro!

Max is very helpful, kind and open minded person. I'm very glad to met him. We had a good time and conversations and he explaned me how to get to different places. The flat stays in very nice place and it is very clean. I definitely recommend him!^^

I stayed with Max for 3 days and I enjoyed it a lot! Max is a trustworthy person and he made the communication really easy from the beginning. He accepted my request quickly and was very flexible to organize my arrival. Also, his home can be very easily accessed by metro, which I think is great, especially if you have heavy luggage. But most importantly, we also had a lot of fun together, long talks, watched a movie and hang out with his friends in a language exchange meeting. I met so many people there and I actually practiced my Spanish that it was a pity I had to leave early on the next day! Max was also very helpful and eager to help me with booking tickets for other places near Madrid. I recommend him to people who are not only interested in staying in Madrid but also have a nice company and do things together during their stay. All in all, I had a very pleasant and comfortable stay with Max and I would recommend him to everyone!
Max, very kind and nice guy, I stayed with him for two nights, it was very easy to communicate with him, I recommend to host and stay with him

Max is a good fellow. Was just as easy to talk to him as to stay silent. He was kind and considerate, offering me a couch outside the agreed dates, when I was almost desperate to find a place to stay. Thank you Max!

Max is a great guy. Id rather give him a bad reference just not to share him with smb else:))) but its not fair. Along with helping me out a looot, giving me tips about places i shall visit, keeping in touch all the time and hanging out with me he made my stay in Madrid very special. I left the city with lots of memories and heartwarming feeling. And i already miss him and the time we've spent together.

I spent 1 day with Max and we really bonded! He was super friendly and hospitable, as well as intelligent and interesting to talk to... not to mention that his place is really cool! 
Thanks a lot :) 
Looking forward to visiting Madrid and Max's again.
Max was a very friendly host,  very accomodating! We watched some great movies together and he even hosted me at the time he went under surgery, and he looks very cool with his new sunglasses üòé

Max was so fun to stay with, kinda like an old buddy! We laughed a bunch, went to a CS language exchange, watched Monty Python's Holy Grail (gold) and went to try Horchata! He's such a cool dude, would recommend 11/10! Thanks again Max, hope to see you soon!

Super host!  :) –¢–æ–æk me to visit a second time and refused to accompany me on the trip to Avila. Had a great time!!!) I am very grateful for a time of fellowship, a house, etc. I learned a lot of new important and interesting information for myself! 
It was my best experience CS! 
I hope we'll meet again some day!

Max is a very calm, smart, clever and kind person. Although he is busy with his job in a well-known International company, but he freely shares his evening time with his guests. He provided me with a private room, bed and table. We had good conversations, shared some tea and enjoyed his photos. He is humbled talented photographer and professional traveler too. Experiencing Max‚Äôs kindness and hospitality, I really enjoyed my stay in his place in Madrid.

text: Max is a great guy and not less great host! He waited me till late and was very welcoming and warm, we had interesting conversations about various things, and it appeared that we travelled in same countries. More over, we both were born in the Far East of Russia and left our home cities at almost the same age. So it was just amazing to discover such coincidence :)

Adrian was my very first non-friend couch surfer, but could not ask for any better first experience. He is all smiles, positive and very easy going person. I like his way of seeing and living live. He made me dinner which was creative and delicious. :P I definitely recommend him!

Adrian is really kind and interesting person with a lot of stories that you will enjoy listening! We was feeling not only like guests but also like old friends. We will never forget this experience and there is no doubt that we would like to stay at his place and see him at least one more time!

Adrian is a really good guy. I‚Äôm so happy to met him. He hosted me and my friend for 2 nights. We didn‚Äôt spend a lot of time together but we had a dinner and drunk very delicious wine and liquor and talked and laughed a lot. Also he met us in airport and it was so nice. I‚Äôm really appreciate. It was my first experience in Couchsurfing but it was sooo good. I felt myself like at home. Adrian did everything to make us feel comfortable. Hope to see you again, Adrian. Now you have a friend in Russia üòä

Adrian received me with opened arms. He treated me so well I fell at home. He could only make me company for one night because he had to travel the next day, so he invited me to stay there, during his absence, 3 more days, until I'd get my flight! He showed a lot of trust for a stranger and I can only thank him and recommend him!

Adrian is great host! I was staying at his flat for 4 days and everyday was special. He show me his best spots ,food, we talk, walk in the city ...blablabla. =)  
I also join his saturday trip to river and waterfalls to escape frome the heat in Madrid. And food! He really knows where to go to eat the teastiest and biggest portions! Adrian I wish you all the best and you are always welcome!   üòÄüòÄ

Adrian's room was very comfortable and he was very kind and mature.

I recommend you to stay with him.

This was my first couchsurfing experience and I'm glad it was with Adrian, because it was really really great. Adrian is super sweet and kind. I met him at his place with a friend of mine and we went for drinks and it was an amazing evening. We talked a lot, laughed, walked, and hugged. He shared with me lots of information about Madrid and Mexico, and taught me some Spanish words. I had a really good sleep at his place and felt like I was sleeping at home. He even woke up at 4:20 am to wake me for my flight and to say good bye; that was so sweet of you Adrian, thank you so much for everything and especially for handling two crazy and dreamy girls! Even at 4 am he was super chill btw lol. 

We decided to meet again for sure in Madrid, as he promised to take me to a good taco place next. Until then, so much love for you dear Adrian üåπüåπ

Me and my friend stayed two nights in Adrian's home. Adrian was our first experience as a host. Before we met him, we were really desperate to find any host in Couchsurfing but Adrien accepted us. He was really but really firindly, knowledgeable and openminded personne that we ever met. He loved to share his food and drinks with us without hesitate. He cooked for us tequenos and that was really beautiful. He was our guide for Madrid. He recommended us lots of good restaurant and bars, he was definitely open hanging out with us. 
And for his home, it was more than we expected. It's very close the city center. It was really clean. Here, we felt like we're at our home. We definitely recommend all of you to Adrian. One day if you are coming to Madrid you can stay at Adrian's home. And he is welcome in Istanbul as well :)

Adrian! first, I want to thank you for hosting my sister and her boyfriend.
I know Adrian is a super cool and helpful guy, without his help Vania and Christian could not make the trip as they did!

He really help them to  organized the trip they wanted to make :) and of course He is a great host!

You are a big inspiration for Vania and Crhistian 

Super highly recommend him!!
fromPublicAddressDescription: San Jose del Cabo, Baja California Sur, Mexico

text: Adrian is  very nice and friendly guy that helped me a lot when I didn't have a place to sleep in Madrid. We took me and my friend for tapas and for a walk in Madrit. We agreed to host us eventhough I message him the same day at 5 pm! Thanks again :)
Adrian is very kind person. He hosted me and my friend and we felt like home in his place. He is very helpful and friendly! Thanks,Adrian! See you in Slovenia ;)

Adrian hosted me for a few nights in Madrid on the biggest air mattress I have ever seen!! Lol. We also shared a beautiful rooftop view of the sun setting over the city and ate some fantastic tapas at La blanca paloma. Thanks for everything, Adrian :)

text: I hosted Fernando four nights, he is such a pleasant, polite and cheerful guy. I did enjoy his company. Thank you for dinner and for gift.

We were glad to host Fernando. He is very nice person, joyful and polite.
It was pleasure to host him.

Fernando was a nice host. He explained us where to go and what to see in Madrid. The location of the apartment is just perfect - right to the metro. It was very nice that he and his gf offered us to show the city.

Hola! In September, we stayed 3 days in Madrid with Fernando and Agatha. We really liked it. Agatha and Fernando are very hospitable, friendly and caring people. Agatha showed beautiful places in the city. Told us where we could go in this city and what time it should be done. 
They have a very bright and clean apartment, which is located in the city centre. Nearby there is the subway . It is very convenient. And they have cool cats! 
They are very nice people and we will be happy to visit him again!
We are waiting for you!!!

Fernando and his girlfriend, Aguta, and her sister, Magda, were so kind and friendly persons. In fact, we couldn't spend time a lot together but they are really nice, considerate, and took care of me although they were busy...:( I appreciate their kindness...:( They are the people who I'd really meet again!!;) See you in Kyoto:) Anyway thank you so much!:)
Andres is a very nice and honest person. You can trust him 100%. We are coming back next year (2019)! Thanks Andres for all!

I am a solo female traveller and i stayed with Andr√©s for one night. Upon reaching Madrid, he waited for me to reach his apartment before leaving for work so i can put down my bag and take a little rest. Very thankful about that. He also showed me around his neighbourhood in the night and let me taste a dish he created himself. I also got a chance to meet his little girls on my last day of stay. He has a very kind heart and went through many hardship, so i wish him all the best in his endeavours! P.s Andr√©s, hang in there, but please don‚Äôt drink too much when you have guests :)

Andres is such a good host. He accepted us last minute and saved us. He has such a cool apartment with an amazing location. Apart from that, he has such a nice soul. He was working when we arrived but joined us for a beer later on. His conversations are interesting and he has a lot to share. He made us feel so comfortable, he even gave us the keys to his apartment. We feel really lucky to have stayed with him and i recommend him to everyone. 
Thank you so much Andes, you are always welcome to Lisbon or Istanbul!!

text: I met up with Javier and we had a really great time. Really thoughtful guy and had a really nice, effortless conversation.

Javi was a great host who made me feel very welcome and relaxed in his lovely flat in the centre of Madrid. Pretty much from the outset, we had a very good rapport and we had some fun times together, both at home and out for a drink/dance at a couple of bars/clubs.  Thanks to his friendly, flexible and accommodating attitude, I  felt very much 'at home' with him, which added considerable value to my overall enjoyment of my time in the city.

fromPublicAddressDescription: San Carlos de Bariloche, R√≠o Negro, Argentina

text:
Javier hosted me for a couple of nights in his centrally located flat in Madrid. Right from the begining he was very flexible with the changes in my travel program/dates, & he gave me the keys of his house so that I can have the freedom to come & go whenever I like, & I'm really grateful for him for that. Moreover, I really enjoyed hanging out with him & talking with him about various deep topics. He has an interesting career which opened the door for us to chat about religion, LGBT issues, organ transplants, euthansia, our travels, our countries, etc..
I highly recommend him as a host & guest, & hope to see him soon again in Barcelona, Cairo or Madrid.
Javier has hosted me a second time and again I enjoyed my stay tremendously. He is funny, kind, trusting and cute.

Javier is a very flexible host. Although declining my initial request for a couch for three nights, because he had to work, he contacted me the day after I had arrived in Madrid, staying in a hostel, and suggested to meet for a drink in the evening. That we did and within 4 hours of talking and laughing got to know each other well enough that he offered  me to stay the other two nights at his place, trusting me with a key, since he still had to go to work. I am very grateful, Not just for the accommodation in his nice and centrally located apartment, but for his experience and skills he shared with me, who is just a beginning couchsurfer and Spanishspeaker. Javier is quite a teacher of important Spanish phrases, even basic Spanish sign language, He showed me the best architectural Madrid sights with illumniation at night and he is good at performing tricks with his fingers. I certainly had a fun time with him. Muchas Gracias, Javier!   Bernd

Raul is a perfect host based in central Madrid. Great location, clean house and great guide too. We went to walk around the main interest of Madrid and shared some vino tinto and tapas. I would recommend him to every surfer going to Madrid.

Javier is truely a wonderful man and a perfect host. I stayed with him for almost 5 days and we spent quite some time together. We had long conversations, shared our thoughts and laughed a lot.

Already the first evening I was in Madrid, Javier introduced me to a group of friends with whom we had a nice dinner.
During the weekend, Javier showed me around in the city and helped me a lot with tips and must-see highlights.

Most important of all, I really felt myself at home with Javier. Although he had to work the last two days of my stay, he fully trusted me and let me stay in his place while he was gone for the day.

I really hope one day I will be able to be Javier's host in the Netherlands. 

We'll keep in touch and from the bottom of my heart I can say I have a new friend in Madrid.

Javier was one of those rare finds. We hit it off like old friends. Not only would I stay with him again. I look forward to being his friend for a lifetime. So caring and helpful. I loved my time with Javier.

fromPublicAddressDescription: Coronel Oviedo, Departamento de Caaguaz√∫, Paraguay

text: Victor and his friend Ruben could only stay with us for one night, but we had great fun chatting before, during and after consuming their most wonderfully prepared tortilla de patates a la Andalucia. They visited most of the important places on these islands and mastered the bus network in a very short time. They left us with instructions on how to enjoy a trial scuba dive session which we believe they undertook. Come again guys - for longer next time!

Victor and his boyfriend Ruben made me feel like I was at home. They are easy going, reflective, open minded and, in my opinion, very inspirational. It is also rare for a couchsurfer to have his own room, so it really gave me a feeling of having both company and privacy. Their apartment is close to the city center, which saves a lot of time. Besides getting awesome reccomendations for the city and having many great conversations with both of them, Victor took me out one night with his friends. It turned out to be the wildest night of my trip.  So special thanks for that, V.

To conclude - I was lucky to have Victor and Ruben as my hosts. I wish you Big Apple in the near future, guys. See you somewhere around!

I had been hosting for the last year, but Victor's apartment in Madrid was the first time I was hosted by another couch surfer.  Victor was  a couch surfer that had previously stayed at my place in NYC and now he was returning the favor. He was so welcoming!! I felt as if I was his friend for years. His partner was also very kind and social, and the apartment was AWESOME! !! Clean, convenient, and cozy with lots of charming personal touches that gave off a very intimate vibe. Walking in for the first time, you immediately sense you are in a home filled with love and it is certainly reflected in the warm ambiance, the tastefully rustic decor, and of course, its constituents. Victor and Reuben are just awesome people all-around and great conversationalists. I hope to see them again someday. They are always welcome in my home.  Thank you guys for allowing me to stay at your home. I had the best time in Madrid over the New Years!!

Victor and Ruben are very nice. I like to speak with them about different topics. There are so friendly and helpful. Victor gave me his home's keys, so it was so easy to plan my Madrid visit, everything was very flexible which i like. 
Thanks for everything Victor, hope see you and Ruben in Turkey.

Would be great to host and have much time together but I hope that we will again.

text:
Oscar was an absolutely AMAZING host- he picked me up and dropped me off from the airport... even though my flight was so early we had to leave the house at 4:45 am. I felt so lucky his mom was around, she was so generous with delicious food and insisting insisting I eat... although I only stayed a few nights I told Oscar I felt so at home at his place. We went out to celebrate his friends surprise birthday, it was fantastic to hang out in downtown Madrid with real Madrile√±os. 

Oscar is kind, generous, interested in history and willing to discuss obscure facts and oft-forgotten countries ... definitely someone I hope to see again. His home was really that- a home. MUCH√çSIMAS GRACIAS POR TODO!! Abrazo fuerte y hasta la pr√≥xima!!

text:
Oscar is really friendly, hospitable and good person, who host us in Madrid on one night. He meet us near metro station, otherwise we would have searched his house for a long time. We had a wonderful dinner. So if you need a host, write him :)

Oscar was kind enough to host me last minute when I came to Madrid. He drove me to and from the airport and made me feel welcome from the very start. He is very easy to talk to and his mom's cooking is great! He has traveled a lot so he is easy to swap travel stories with.  Oscar also knows a lot about his home country so I learned a lot. Thanks so much Oscar for your hospitality!!

Staying with √ìscar was such a pleasure! My plane arrived very late and he was kind enough to come get me. Despite the rain and the holiday we had a great time with some beers and friends - I look forward to our next meeting :D

√ìscar is one of them guys who are super laid back about everything, he's very flexible, easy going, goes with the flow of things and this made my stay with him very enjoyable. He's very generous and makes very nice foooood! Easy to talk to and has some very interesting stories. He also spent a whole day walking me through the 'local' parts of Madrid which was a lovely insight. He was a great host! I hope to see him in Australia some time! :-)

√ìscaar! He is very hospitable, friendly, open minded and thoughtful. I am very glad to meet him! 
He hosted me in his pretty house in Madrid, helped me a lot(took me from metro station, helped me to find my way etc.)

He has a lot to share, I really recommend him!

Rosa :)

text: First I waited 45 minutes for him at station, without any sign where he was (I arrived 8 PM and 5 PM we confirmed this time) & no apologize when h√© arrived. I traveled all day and was really tired. He said he wanted to go to friends place to eat together, but I said I was really tired and maybe we could drop my luggage first at his place and then decide (maybe he could go solo). Yet, we suddenly went to his friend, without any notice from me and he didn't announce it. I really try to suit at the host, because I'm glad if I can sleep at someone's place and respect their life and what they want to do, √≠f they do same for me. But he just didn't listen to me at all and was groaning all the time and saying 'no worries, you will have enough rest'. How do you know? Next morning he offered me biscuits and I asked if I could take two pieces of bread. That was all. So don't understand your strange reaction. Sorry, but for ME it was really not nice. Don't know how he behaves in other situations.

text:
We met with Oscar on a linguistic web-site, both of us are interested in studying languages. One day he found out that I was looking for a host in Madrid and generously proposed to receive me in his house. He even picked me up from the bus station. He showed me around, I saw things I had never seen before ;) We were at CouchSurfing meeting, visited some of main curiosities of Madrid, √ìscar told me a lot of local stories and anecdotes. I should say that he always took me in his car, I think that deserves appreciation, too. I'm highly impressed with my visit to Madrid and especially with my host, he is such a good man, in √ìscar¬¥s house I felt myself like in my own. And his mother, that's a dream, she is a typical Spanish woman, optimistic and easy-going. I think √ìscar learnt a lot from her :) So, I utterly recommend √ìscar to everyone who is looking for a host in Madrid, you'll never regret it ;)

As for me, I just want to say one thing - Muchas gracias, √ìscar, mi casa es tu casa ;)

text:
I don't even know where to begin to describe our experience with Oscar, to me he became more than a host, but truly someone I can call a friend. Butterfly ! 
Thank you so much for everything !

Many thanks for that day!

fromPublicAddressDescription: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark

text: Miguel is very friendly and nice to hang out with. Even I have a chance to host him only one night but I can see that it is a good decision to have him with me. I would drop him off at the airport if I didn‚Äôt have appointment this morning. Wish you all the best

What an amazing couchsurfing experience. Miguel accepted my request pretty fast. He's super kind, generous, polite, funny, smart, well educated and¬† respectful host as well as a great man and cool guy. Within first minutes he told me: "Man, feel like at home". And yeah, these two days I had feeling like I'm at my home. Normally it takes weeks, but with Miguel's hospitality it took just one hour. He's experienced traveler, so we spent together a lot of time talking about countries we have visited, sharing our impressions. Miguel knows everything about every single building, street, place in Madrid, he's a perfect tour guide. I was lucky enough to come on the weekend when Miguel was free. I really enjoyed our bar crawling as well as gastro tour around city center of Madrid. I was guided through all Spanish dishes and tasted all of them. I definitely recommend Miguel as a great host and guest. Thank you so much for everything amigo, I hope that I've got a new friend. Asta luego!

text: I stayed in Miguel‚Äôs place for 4 days and I can say that he‚Äôs a funny, friendly and 100% reliable guy. He can show you around Madrid and tell you some interesting facts about the city. I would stayed with hom again!

Alonso is a nice and friendly person besides being very athletic: he stayed only two days and he climbed two mountains, wow! I enjoyed a lot to speak with him in Spanish, a language  I love it.

Dinesh is a very friendly and respecful guest, absolutly reliable and uncomplicated. It was nice to have him here.
Dinesh is a very friendly and warm-hearded guy. He cooked for us the best tandoori- chicken I have ever eaten... I would definitly host him again!

Dinesh is a very nice and open guy. He asks a lot of questions and was very interested in Austria's culture. He even offered to cook for me, but I just got back from a month of travelling so unfortunately I was rather busy.

text: Segio left an I am very sad. The only thing that is reminding me of Sergios stay is my new Google in Spanish and the mop on a stick. He said I treated him like a slave, so he gave me as a present the most Spanish thing possible - something (mop) on a stick. I guess he didn't like cleaning the floor on his knees when I asked him to. He also hurt his foot while travelling so he pursued on us that he had to stay the whole three weeks at our place, how tactless. And at the end he forced me into his dictatorship of love. Sergio come back. I don't know now how to live without the dictatorship of love. I'm like a lost (Icelandic) lamb not knowing my way back to the silver tent.

text:
Totally positive!
The Rusticos - easy, lovely musicians and each of them a wonderful person - when i found them with their guitars sitting on my doorstep i nearly immediatelly fell in love with them. 
We went out, tried to undercut the Munich nightlife "deadlines", but after some tries (and some german beer) we ended sitting  in my room, listening to tom waits, drinking their special liquor.
as the first (better the second) daylight interrupted our conversations they were nearly gone again! 
The short breakfast wasn¬¥t enough as well- you¬¥re welcome back here anytime again!

Yo

text:

come again next year. let's all play together at theaterspektakel... and make a big chaos band!

text:

Ciaoooooo tios, have a nice trip!

text:
What a treat to have met Sergio and his Ukulele (special thanks to Mary Lou ;) It was a joy to hang out with them in the parks of Madrid and philosophize about this and that. He could stand my singing and my trials to play the ukulele. We had a really good time and for me it felt like a long brotherhood from beginning on. Sergio is a very flexible, easy going person who knows how to enjoy the simplicity of life. 
Keep it up, my friend!
See you in August in Vienna!
--------
And it was a treat to see you again as well as meeting the rest of the R√∫sticos. You guys pulled me out of my working marathon in such a nice way, thanks for that! And I was really charmed by the privat concert which you held for me ;)
I wish we would have had more time but I am sure we'll prolong it, wherever it will be in this beautiful world (maybe I follow you guys next year on your tour... any plans yet? ;)
inverseReference: {'id': '3250383', 'text': "Even I can't finally host Verena, she was hosted by a good friend and we spend some time together watching the sunlight passing by from a variety of parks in Madrid. While we were seducing the camera in the dark, my eyes got burned by the flash, but until that moment I saw Verena is really a beautiful person to spend time with. \r\nLater that year, in Vienna, Verena hosted us in her great flat, we went to swim in the river, we made a band in the kitchen, the boys were so pleased to meet her and I was very happy to see her again. text: Nice guy who helped me out in Madrid. It was nice to meet him and hope to see him soon. Thanks laguna

Well I didn't surf with Sergio but I ended up staying in one of the rooms he rents. The place is in a great location, close to anything you might want to do in Madrid. The other folk in the apartment were nice and respectful and I'd definitely recommend checking out his rentals if you can't find a couch!

Sergio was a delight! We immediately got along and had fun back and forth banter. He's got the best dog, who we walked around the city. He brought me for some sweet food and recommended things I'd have never seen otherwise. But really he's just such an awesome guy, and I'm stoked to have made a friend out of him. We spent a good long time chatting and sharing ideas. I will one hundred percent stay with him again the next time I'm in Madrid. He's a real character who is worth meeting!

I had a great stay in Madrid with R√∫stico. He was very friendly and made me feel welcome at his place. He respected my privacy and time alone, but he also liked to chat with me and spend some time together. The room was big, the sofa was comfy, and the location was very good and central too, so all in all I had a great experience. üòÄ Thank you!

text:
Sergio is awesome. He accepted me becoming a piece of furniture instead of a one night stay - my deepest apologies for this, of course. Other than his sweet nature, has a great taste in music, awesome sense of humour and in general a really cool, interesting  guy to hang out with. Maybe irrelevant, but he also has an impressive collection of instruments.

Again, thank you heaps, I highly enjoyed my stay!

Sergio! aka Mr. RuSticO or the Dali of Madrid  helped me out in a big time of need when i had a family emergency and let me crash for the night, last minute, and drop my stuff off for the day. YOU'RE THE MAN SURGE! :) muchas gracias again amigo, I'll definitely give you a shout next time I'm in your city.

Cheers! Evan

He took me to his place although he had to handle with a lot of things he had to care and suffer about. i could sleep in a room because there was by chance a place, but normally there are couches for surfers.
he hosts also people from r&b but you rarely see them.
you can be inspired from sergio and have good conversations. he has a big big heart, and wants to help you where he can.
thank you for hosting me !!
We just hung out, he is nice and friendly.
There is St.Sergio in Madrid. Half of him is made of the gypsum. The other half is beautiful too.

Well, I'm not so experienced csurfer but what i like the most about it its some kind of Tarot chance about who you will meet or who you will stay with.  And magic things do happens. Like my staying in Madrid with Sergio. Actually i can't devide my experience and inspiration from Madrid from Sergio... Madrid = Sergio and Sergio=Madrid.
His place was for me some kind of white rabbit's hole with a lot of wonders, creativity and madness (in good sense)).

I can't promise it will be the same to you as it depends on your luck, karma and stars positions)). And maybe you don't need it as I did...
But what I can say for sure, Sergio is full of real life, great humor, creativity and respect to other's private space. 
Sergio thank you for Madrid and everything.
Hugs  :)

I stayed with Sergio for 6 Nights (the last one with my husband as well). 
The flat is really cozy, full of details and located in the Center of Madrid. Sergio is a friendly, opendminded  person and helped me out while i was ill.  He went to the farmacy with me and helped me to buy medicine. 
I can totally recommend him as a host and would stay with him again. 
Thanks a lot, Sergio! You are very welcome at my place in cologne :)

Well, what an experience for a first time couch surfer! Sergio has certainly set the bar high for CS. He took me in last minute even though I couldn't tell him how long I would be in Madrid while I sort out my next moves/my life. He handed me a spare set of keys and left me to it. We took to the park with his clarinet and my silks and we had a evening jam followed by a "gin crawl" and ramblings on life. Top guy. Top experience. Wish him the best. I'm sure I'll see him again. Some place, some where.
I regret having stayed only one night at Sergio's place. He's so much fun, attentive and very interesting to talk to. Thank you so much for the beautiful evening Sergio and hope we meet again!

I had a blast staying with RuSTICO. He showed me a lot of great things about Madrid and I felt really at home with him and his flatmates. They were all really friendly and Rustico was super accommodating and accepting. Also, a loving dog lives in the house, which was awesome! 

I couldn't say more positive things about Rustico, he has a great sense of humour, flawless good looks and an open heart. Sergio,  I hope that you can come and visit me in the future so we can play some more music and talk like a couple of weirdos in the night!

Cheers and thanks a bunch

I stayed with Sergio for 4 nights. I had a memorable times with him. He got a cool decorated apartment which always on with the cool musics of his vinyl collections. He hanged around one of the plaza nearby the neighborhood. Which was the way to enjoy the night like the locals. We shared our thoughts in many topics including our what to do in our life lol. This made us become friends quickly. I really want him to visit me in Thailand. I hope it wont take too long until the next time we meet!

What sweet guy! i feel so lucky to cross paths with such an agreeable, easy going and passionate person. ƒ∞n fact ƒ∞ can say that after my stay with him (them) i've gained the slightest hope on my pessimistic view on humanity ahah the same of course goes to his room mates!
Ah and mustn't forget my love.. Toto, we had something special going on there..
He handled all my awkwardness with grace :P walked with me all around Madrid, introduced me to more wonderful people and even gave me an awesome concert without even realising hehe.
His flat was (is) beautiful, full of character and creative details. ƒ∞ts cozy vibe made me feel at home the minute i stepped in.
ƒ∞ hope sincerely hope we meet again one day!  ƒ∞ wish you all the happiness and everything that goes with it :) 

:P https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=IYlE_AbNdkI

My stay with Sergio was nothing but wonderful...His sensitive, creative soul, his wonderful flatmates and Herman the chinchilla are forever staying in my heart...Thank you for the warm welcome, for showing me Madrid, thank you for the interesting conversations and the rosemary chips...lots of love and see you again xxx

text: Mmmmh let's see. It's quite intimidating to write a 71st reference, and the fact that this watermelon guy has got more references than my granma's years, already tells a lot about him! I'll try to be quick and synthetic. Sergio welcomed me with the most chilled-out vibe ever, and as a natural consequence of this, I truly felt at home in his home, almost right away. I loved his histrionic collection of instruments, his very calm and "go-with-the-flow" attitude, as well as his brightness and funny stories. We spend some good time hanging around in the Reina Sofia Museum during the free visit hours, eating a really good turkish meal in the park, and rambling in the vibrant barrio of Lavapi√©s. Needless to say, I fell in love with Madrid, and I think this is a bit of Sergio's fault as well. He's a great guy.

Thank you again very much again to you and your flatmates! you guys are amazing!

text: Sergio and everyone in his apartment/band/chinchilla welcomed me immediately :) We didn't get to spend so much time together, as everyone was busy getting ready for their show that friday, but the time that we did get to spend together chatting late with the other sufer at night while he fixed his guitar was great! text:
Sergio was an amazing host! He welcomed me with a big hug, we ate a tortilla together bigger than my head (with the same amount of grease) that totally didn't upset his girlfriend's stomach, I got to jam with him on a tenor ukelele, Marike and him went dancing all weekend with me in a hotel which may have been from space, we danced to loud blues music in his house and I'll never hear 'Vampire Blues' by Neil Young again without also hearing a theramin. 

Sergio is a really warm person, loves to talk about sex (because Basque people never have it apparently), and also a really great musician! Siskel and Ebert give 2 zombie thumbs up!

text: I couchsurfed with Sergio for one last-minute night, he was kind enough to offer a couch even though the CS Palace was taken! He showed me the little cinema where he works and the 'beast' room where the projectors live. But the highlight of this experience is his intimate story he has with Martin Parr :P We had a musical jam with his housemate, Vanessa and spoke a lot about Galicia and Basque country, which has inspired me to visit (where I am now and enjoying very much!) It was only a short stay but I had lots of fun, and great exchange of stories and music! Hopefully we'll meet again!

text:
Well I together with my two old, old (meaning not old, but i know them for a long time :D )  friends Maria and Raisa were looking for a place, where to establish our small colony, from where we could explore Madrid. We found it. 	
muchas gracias Sergio. I am amazed by your musical talent (especially liked song you were playing exactly at the time we were going to sleep around 3 in the night :D :D  ...it was something about It's three in the morning and I'm turning in my bed :D :D . it was touching . Great thanks for introducing us with your friends. amazing karaoke ... and a bit less amazing cinema .
And i really believe Alberto didn't feel bad about having guests around. ^_^ So much thanks to say. so i better will not continue, otherwise i would have to write a diary about all we did in Madrid (plus Toledo), cause it was all as they are singin' "little help of my friends". Cause of you

text: Sergio and his house mates showed me a great time in Madrid. Occasionally we got out of the dark cupboard to explore the art world, - there were many laughs along the way. Especially along the way home when Cathy and Sergio shared their sex sounds with the stray Spanish couples in doorways. Sorry about the bed Sergio, it wasn't me it was the green monster. (I forget his name)... Anyhoo, you are bound to feel at home with this relaxed household who really enjoy a reason to get together and share a laugh. - i miss them already!
inverseReference: {'id': '2106625', 'text': "It was a pleasure to host Pia, She's nice, intelligent, easy-going, funny and very interesting... (Hanna is right, what a beautiful person!). text: my friends and I stayed at sergio's for four nights... que *chevere*!!! whether we were just hanging around at his place or getting lost in madrid's bars (or on our way to find them ;-) ), we felt very comfortable and shared some pretty interesting conversation about a whole lot of things... sergio is an open-minded guy who has a special sense of humour and a good musical taste. I'd be nice to "pay him back" for the time we had in madrid by hosting him one day, so be welcome!

text: Sergio is a great guy! We met up the night before & he took us to an awesome/cheap tapas place (not vegan friendly though). You should definitely ask him to show you where this place is. We had a wonderful time with him. We jammed, we shared meals, had great laughs & he let us in on a little secret, everybody's must have for this winter season: the iJam 5Js! He even met up with us at the Atoche station a couple of days later while we were on our way to Barcelona. Sergio is funny, creative and very interesting & we only wish we could have spent more time together. We'll be waiting for Rustico Acoustico to play at the Festival d'ete in Quebec soon:) see you then!

Wishing you all the best!
Elena

I was so lucky to be hosted by Marco in Madrid, I asked him to stay for 3 days and ended up staying almost a week! He's flatemates are also really nice. 
Don't miss you chance to meet this unique Napolitano if you're in Madrid, be sure he will be your best guide!

Since I stayed two years ago the first time In Marco's house via couchsurfing he actually turned in one of my best friends :D I can only recommend you to stay with him course Marco has an amazing couchsurfing spirit, is really funny and knows a lot about other countries ;) 
I hope to see you soon in Germany and hope that our friendship will last a really long time. Un besito, Claudia :)

Marco is simply awesome! He is very energetic person. He inspired me to visit Thailand and I can't wait to go over there. Marco showed me around Madrid, he even cooked for me green curry. It was delicious.  I'd highly recommend Marco as a host. Thank you so much amigo and see you soon!

Marco helped me quite lastminute on a couch in Madrid. I just stayed for 1 night, which I highly regret, since Marco was a very very nice host :) super considerate, friendly and mindful. His area is great (although he probably has to move soon?), which made the stay even nicer. Since he had to work in the evening, we could only hang out a bit the next day, which was way too short, since I really enjoyed talking with him. He appears to be quite knowledgeable and he's a good listener (which is definitely not for everyone). I hope we will meet soon, somewhere in the world, on a beautiful crazy inspiring event or.... just for a coffee :) I hope other couchsurfers will have the luck to meet Marco! adios

text:
Fernando is very fun and easy person, smiles a lot and hosts You very well :)

I enjoyed every moment lived in San Sebastian, at Fernandos place :) Good time, lot of smiles, interesting food (gastronomy), geography tours,  some or lot of touristic knowledge :), yami home-cooked breakfast and very enjoyable conversations.

Muchas Gracias ;)

Fernando is one of those people you need to have around if you want to take life easy and enjoy whatever you're doing, so I highly reccommend him as a host!

My friend Liepa and I really enjoyed the time spent with him in San Sebastian: I think we would have missed out on the nightlife and on a few good, cheap places if it weren't for him!The coffee place he took us to was a must, and the simple, cheap pixtos bar was a nice change from the posh touristy places we'd ended up in previously. Ask him, he'll tell you where to go to avoid rip-offs!

For me it was also really nice to be able to speak in Italian with him (and his funny Italian flatmate Mauro), it made me feel at home and comfortable.

Grazie per le chacchierate, per il tempo che ci hai dedicato e scusa per averti svegliato nel cuore della notte parlando nel sonno!:)E' stato un vero piacere conoscerti, fatti vivo semmai vorrai venire a Bordeaux che ti offro un bicchiere di vino!;)
Alla prossima
Sara

{'id': '14171842', 'text': "The 2 coolest surfers I had in San Sebastian!

I love the details they left for me, like, leaving cool notes in the kitchen's wall and the best gift.......NUTELAAA!! that was such a great detail from them.
If you find her in your way, feel yourself lucky, because you'll be!

Sara, maybe see you in Bordeaux, or in some other place maybe back here, regards from Mauro and keep travelling!!

text:
We came to San Sebastian when it was dark, rainy and a bit cold. We didn't like the city from the first sight, and thought okay... now what?

Then we meet Fernando, a very simple, fun-loving guy who took us to a cozy cafe (approved not only by me but by my Italian friend as well, so if you love good coffee, beg Fernando to show the cafe) and shared his experience on travelling, gave some tips on what to do and see around Donostia. 

Fernando is one of the reasons why we started liking the city. The time spent with him talking, going out and even having breakfast together will always be bright things to remember.

Once again, Fernando, thank you for being patient when we were two hours late, for making us feel like home at your place (which turns into a hostel every summer), preparing your favorite breakfast for us, and smiling all the time!

More than welcome in Bordeaux, come and you will have the chance to practice French as well as have some fun.
inverseReference:
{'id': '14171753', 'text': "Well first of all I gotta say, that I haven't hosted people in a while, but hosting Liepa and her friend Sara, reminded me, why I used to do it! after reading her message, I inmediately knew she was different person (the kind of cool ones!) so I said myself, of course I have to host them. 
So, it turned on in such a great experience. She is a really nice, fun, talkative, interesting, smart, and I can keep going, but i just wanna say that if you have the opportunity to host or meet her, do it! otherwise you'll miss the opportunity to see her cute smile and get to know the nice person behind :)

Liepaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaa!! I hope to see you around, maybe I'll take your word and I'll head to Bordeaux very soon, and you know you have a house here, anytime you want to come back (hopefully soon)

text:

text: Lucia is a great example of what couchsurfing is all about. She is lively and obviously enjoys life. Her positive attitude communicates to everything she does. I am sure if we lived closer together, we would be best of friends. it felt like she was my sister. I hope to see her again, maybe at my house next time.
Alexandra was an amazing guest, so sweet and easy going..,and  funny, I enjoyed her company a lot and would host her again and again..

What a wonderful man!!!

We wait for you in Hamburg or Montreal!! 
‚ô•

I wish I had a backpack big enough to bring Carlos back home with us.

A real gentleman, with infinite knowledge of his hometown, and such enthusiasm!

Carlos left us with a lasting impression, and when we will sit on our asses back home there's some part of us that will wish we still were in Madrid, with Mr Tapas y Cerveza.

text:
Wow! Where to start! We have yet to meet anyone as kind, generous, helpful, and fun in our travels! 
Marco was able to show us around beautiful Madrid! We had a wonderful time sightseeing, even more fun partying! 
It was a wonderful experience, because he had multiple CS at once, so there was a great opportunity to meet even more travellers!
Thanks for EVERYTHING (hermano)! This trip would not have been the same! We are lucky to have met you and Toni, and look forward to seeing you again!!!!!
Janine and Sam

Marco and I were introduced by a friend of his and we spent a night out with other CS in Madrid. Lots of good times! He is a really fun guy to know and sure does know his city! Gracias amigo. Nos vemos en Madrid o en Montreal! jajaja

I sent Marco a request a few days before my arrival in Madrdi because i was desperatly looking for a couch. He answered immediately and I arrived with one of my friend at his place a few days later. We arrived in the morning and Marco was very welcoming, we talked a bit and then we were ready for Madrid! Marco was an awesome host, he took us for a tour of Madrid to some really cool places, we walked for hours. Staying with Marco was a very good experience because you get the chance to meet Marco but also the other couchsurfers he's hosting. It's just like a small family!Unfortunately i only stayed one night at his place but I highly recommend him as a host!
I hope I'll get the chance to see Marco again, in Madrid or Paris.

text:
Marco is just the perfect host! He is friendly, open-minded, enthusiastic and warm hearted (just as us latins). We had a great time, even though it was short we enjoyed his company so much. His flat is amazing, so his housemate and friends. We were so lucky to be with him, thanks to that we were able to watch a Real Madrid training in the very Santiago Bernabeu! And the second night we watched the match together. Seriously, I can't imagine someone not liking this guy.
Looking forward to see you again and to host you in Mexico! 

Terminar nuestro viaje con Marco fue perfecto para cerrar con broche de oro! Gracias!

text: We havent met Ignacio, but his roommate David because he was in Spain. David was the best host you could have in Lissbon. Because he had to work during the afternoons, he arrenged that some of his friends took care of us, so they showed us a little bit around and during the evenings we met all together, cooked, went out and just spent time with each other. We felt so comfortable that we definetley wanna come back to Lissbon to chill more with these really nice peolpe:)bejios de nosotras

Ignacio and his flatmates are amazing! Me and my friends have spend 2 days with them! Ignacio seems to me really interseting, it's a pity that i couldn't speak with him more! His flatmates Linda and David were great Lisbon Brazilians guides ;) for the day and night life!!
Ignacio also gave us the best advice: to go to ANDAN√áA festival in north Portugal. We changed our roadtrip plan to go, and i don't regret at all, i really loved this festival, and i want to come back as soon as i can.

text: After meeting them, we were in the best tapas place of Mostoles within the hour, drinking beer and having a blast. Especially after the beer and tapas in one of the best places of Madrid. We loved doing the tourist thing the Spanish way with them. text: Joseph is The Host. He offered us a place to stay during the long weekend in Madrid just before I gave up looking for a host. Everybody was decling my requests. Very friendly and flexible. Joseph gave me and my friend a place to stay for 3 nights in Madrid, in a really good location. 
His place is just amazing, clean, warm and sooo comfy.
It was a pleasure to meet such a kind and friendly guy.  We had fun, watching TV in the evenings, he let us try indian food, which was absolutely yummy!
Also very helpful with all we needed.
We are so thankful and glad we could stay at his place!
Take care Joe! 
Always welcome at our place!

Barbora & Ivana

text: I had √† good moment with Ruben :) he  is a nice person. Discret but interesting to talk with about art ! A good and calm couchsurfer

Ruben is a friendly mate. He is always up to hang out and interested to taste and learn different culture. He introduced me a traditional Spanish food from his hometown in North. In addition, he is also eager to know new people. We spent a lot of time in discussing Politics in his Spain particularly, histories, people and etc. He also taught me some new Spanish words since I am currently focusing on it. I also thank him for a red sweet Spanish apron as a gift. I recommend him and personally look forward to meeting him in the future.

Ruben is a very interesting and friendly person, He's also really sweet : he brought me a gift from Spain and wrote me a lovely card to thank me for hosting him. He was also independent, and fine with exploring by himself, as I was crazy busy with my thesis. (sorry we didn't get to spend more time together!) I enjoyed talking with him about random things like art, travels, and life and I would definitely host him again, and hope to see him again next time I'm in Madrid :)

Ruben is a very good hearted, inteligent young man. Can recomend him  to any future host of him. Can't wait to visit Madrid,  hoping Ruben to be able to host me back. All the best my friend (tomorrow I go to the post, sorry forgot)

Ruben is a great guy.. he's shy at first but then he let it roll. He stayed with us in his last day in London and even though we had time for a last minute party.  He had a few pounds left and he decided to get some groceries for us and invited us to visit and stay wth him in Spain. Very kind :)

Ruben is a kind, thoughtful nice person with a sweet heart! He is sooo friendly!! I came to Madrid to take a spanish course and stayed at his place for almost a week  (2 days turned into 1 week! ).  He took me around in the city and taught me the spanish culture  helping me out in many ways  even he was busy with his school and work. I was really lucky to meet him on the first week of my stay in Spain, I never felt isolated nor alone! His favorite music, tea or caffetteria became my favorite too,  we had some sort of common sense, and I was feeling so comfortable with it.  I really appreciate that I could find a person like him, and I'm sure everyone can feel like I do when you meet him!! Gracias Ruben!!:)

Ruben was initially shy, but always very sweet. We sometimes had troubles communicating in English (and I don't speak any spanish!), but we always got along. Ruben was happy to tag along to the film festival I was visiting in Madrid and it was nice to have a companion. His apartment is very very cosy, and also tidy and in a really nice area. He helped me try all of the spanish delicacies I had been meaning to taste. Gracias Ruben, and embajadores!

Thank you so much again Ruben, this is the second time I stay in his home and let me just say this : he's the Perfect host !
No matter how busy or tried he can be, he always finds time to spend time with me, I also got the change to meet his great friends, very sweet and funny people. I'm always glad to be back in Madrid and Ruben is the reason why :)

Rubens is a very cool guy with which I could experience a part of Madrid Life.  Even though I stayed 2 days at his place, I met him all the days of my trip. He gave me good advices and we made cool things. I got good vibes in Madrid. XD

Ruben interesting person. He loves his profession, ready to talk  a lot about   art history. He always helps, tell interesting places to visit. His apartment - an expression of his personality. Cozy and contains a lot of books. I'm glad to meet you!

Spending time with Aurora is more nourishing for your soul than watching a sleeping child. We went for 2 nice walks and when we couldn't find beauty we invented it. We fasted on soup and imagination and learned subtle and important things, like for example she taught me how to make a mold of my own teeth. Highly recommended--5 stars like a movie or a hotel or the night sky in Madrid

text:
Aurora. The name truly sounds fascinating but the person manifesting it is equally awesome . She was so sweet to accept my last minute request in Brussels and my my I had the best time with her, her BF leo and their Methane roomie(the name of whom I forgot) haha. 

We danced, spoke and made tea and then got high on an amazing dinner. Also jammed with music. Definitely a place I would like to go back to. Btw, aurora is an awesome dancer, just okay some electro swing to her. Haha.

HIGHLY RECOMMENDED couchsurfer because of her compassion towards others and helpfulness. Looking forward to meeting u guys for some more time now.take care . üòäüëçüèª

text: Ricardo & I enjoyed a fun if a little short bike ride around my local area. He was quick to respond to my very last minute change of plan announced the second we met at Charing Cross station! The evening was beautiful - the sun bringing out the smiles in many passers by. So do you think the English are a friendly bunch? Well they were tonight! Especially the lady walking a rather pretty dog :-) I really wish we had more time senor! Ricardo is such a nice guy, very approachable & I'm guessing a great host in Madrid - where I certainly intend to visit again. Tapas here we come....See you soon amigo.

text:

text: Staying with Diego and Eva was my first true couchsurfing experience, and I must say that it was well worth it. They went out of their way to make me feel at home, entertain me, and feed me well. Not only that, but Diego helped me sort some things out about learning how to travel, and talking with Eva improved my Spanish immensly. Thanks to Diego and Eva, I now have friends in Madrid, and I recommend that anyone who wants to get to know good people and have great conversations should stay with them too.

do host him if you get the chance.
hope we'll meet again somewhere,

text:
Jeff is a lot of fun and the perfect companion to explore cities with. He doesn't need a world wonder to be fascinated by a place, so long as it has a few beautiful corners and good coffee or food. In fact, with him, places I already knew became more magical (or hilarious), just because I myself don't notice when there are three puzzle pieces arranged neatly on a muddy tile of a sidewalk.
Anyone should have a Jeff visit them someday, he makes rainy days to glittery ones!
inverseReference: {'id': '9192139', 'text': "Simone is a great friend and always up for silly adventure. Somehow she always knows the best places to dance wild, the best churches in which to light little candles, and the best little pasta shops. text:
Even my difficult mood and my deep problems I was really happy during our time together. I couldnt host him but I could go to show my favourite places in Granada, he is grateful, smiling and good talkative person. I am glad to hear his interesting travel and life stories.
It's a pitty I didnt have enought time, so, I hope meet again in somewhere.
thanks Jeff ;)
inverseReference: {'id': '9113604', 'text': "Antonio wasn't able to host me in Granada but we met up and he took me in his car for a tour of his favorite hidden places in Granada. text: I had good feelings about Jeff from the very first time I saw him, so that's why I left him my keys and everything. Unfortunately he stayed just one night but I hope that he will come back to Sevilla soon.

text: Jeff was an absolute pleasure to have here in Posadas. He is good fun, intelligent and just a pleasant person to be around. Together we drank, watched some dark comedy, and walked to a lovely castle. All in all a great experience and I'd recommend anyone to host Jeff in the future! (Plus he has an excellent knowledge of edible plants/fruit!)
inverseReference: {'id': '9048360', 'text': "Jamie was an excellent host. We met up for a couple glasses of wine in Sevilla due to chance and coinciding travel plans, then took the train to Posadas. We walked around Cordoba and that evening made some great pasta with whatever we could find in his kitchen and some rosemary I'd stolen from the palace. Some dark comedy, bottles of beer from the bar on the corner, one of those Spanish tables with a heater underneath; everything was good. We hiked some 14 kilometers to a castle and back, and shared some bread and apples. I had a wonderful time. Thank you, Jamie. You're welcome to La Solana anytime as long as you're not looking for very interesting touristy things.", 'createdDate': '2011-12-11T20:50:54Z', 'experience': 'positive', 'relationshipType': 'surf', 'isPostTrip': False, 'to': {'id': '2463304'}, 'from': {'id': '3143282', 'publicName': 'Jeffrey Frey', 'publicAddress': {'id': '5848403', 'description': 'Madrid, Comunidad de Madrid, Spain'}, 'avatarUrl': 'https://s3.amazonaws.com/images.couchsurfing.us/L3SF9PF/13902372_l_819a6d040d5c2136dd0124de3bbe1ae0.jpg', 'status': 'maybe', 'isVerified': True, 'isDeleted': False, 'blockedBy': None}, 'inverseReference': None, 'response': None}

{'id': '8505874', 'text': 'This was my first time couchsurfing and it could not have been more perfect. Paul and his two roommates have a great apartment in the center of Madrid within walking distance of all the important things. And they¬¥re all great people. I arrived and was welcomed like family. They took me all over the city, to see the sites and the caf√©s and the dance clubs. They cooked great food almost every night and were always great company with great conversations (even though I didn¬¥t contribute much as my Spanish wasn¬¥t completely up to par). They took me on long walks through the parque del buen retiro and drove me to the mall to get a cell phone. Paul lent me his bed and stayed in the other room, which he didn¬¥t have to do and which was very nice. After a few days we became good friends, even though I didn¬¥t speak Spanish that well, and they are more than welcome to stay in my apartment in La Solana anytime they wish. ¬°Gracias amigos peruanitos!', 'createdDate': '2011-09-23T17:50:39Z', 'experience': 'positive', 'relationshipType': 'surf', 'isPostTrip': False, 'to': {'id': '1840498'}, 'from': {'id': '3143282', 'publicName': 'Jeffrey Frey', 'publicAddress': {'id': '5848403', 'description': 'Madrid, Comunidad de Madrid, Spain'}, 'avatarUrl': 'https://s3.amazonaws.com/images.couchsurfing.us/L3SF9PF/13902372_l_819a6d040d5c2136dd0124de3bbe1ae0.jpg', 'status': 'maybe', 'isVerified': True, 'isDeleted': False, 'blockedBy': None}, 'inverseReference': None, 'response': None}

text: Daniel is extraordinary! He hosted me very friendly at his place in Madrid and together we went to different parties with his friends. He tried to perfect his Paella twice while we travelled together and then when I hosted him. I hope he return again.. or I meet him in some other place.. because the paella Can only get better!!!

text: We enjoyed the 3 days Christian spent with us visiting city and countryside. Although he said us it was his first couchsurfing experience, he was a very polite and nice guest.  We can recommend him to further hosts and not only because he bring us some delicious Spanish ham ;)

Hosting Alex was very nice. He is a really relax, open-minded,  and funny.  Alex is full of adventures, so you will never bored with him.  We shared very nice time together in a short time(including pepper gas:)). 
 Hope to see you again Alex in somewhere. Take care! be alive:))

I stayed with Alberto for one night... it was a good experience! He‚Äôs friendly and attentive and a great conversationalist. We didn‚Äôt get to spend much time together because of previously arranged plans and work but the time we did spend together was lovely! Thank you for everything!

I spent good times in Alberto's. His flat is well located, clean and pretty. But this is not the most important ! 
Alberto is a nice guy. I can provide help if needed or leave you quiet and autonomous if you want. It's up to you. I had the chance to go out with him and his friends for a nice night (restaurant, disco).
Unfortunately he may stop receiving people on CS but get in touch with him to know more about it. Thanks guy ! See you later if I have the chance to come back in Madrid.
Alberto is a great person and an excellent host. He hosted me and my friend for 2 days and it was a great staying for us.

Alex is sociable person who love adventures. Glad to know him and he takes Amazing pictures!

I final him easy to talk to very open and understanding !

Alex and Julia were extremely warm and sweet. We enjoyed homemade veggie lasagna and gazpacho first night with their friends too, and talked about "extreme sports" haha on the nice balcony.  They were flexible with our late and weird travel plans. Look forward to coming back and spending more time with each other and in nature around Madrid!

Matteo and Ofelia are the best hosts!! Ofelia is really cute, cuddly, and playful, and Matteo is intelligent, friendly, and fun. From the get-go he made me feel super comfortable. My first night it felt like we had been friends for years. He also knows a lot about Spain and Madrid in general so he recommended to me a lot of great places in the city. In the evenings we relaxed to great music with good wine, jamon, and cheese, went to a hill top that overlooked the city one night, and on the weekend went out to great restaurants and bars. And riding his motorbike was fun! Also, he let me arrive a night early and when my bus to leave Madrid was too full, he let me stay an extra night. His flat is clean, the sofa bed was very comfortable, he's walking distance to the city center, and super close to the metro. Matteo is a great human and I'm so happy to have spent time with him and become very good friends. On a scale of 1 to 10, Matteo is an 11 ‚ù§

I need to say thank you matteo...for hosting me, giving some really good advice and showing me a quiet great place :) !
It was really nice to meet you, you are an great guy with an supernice and a bit crazy cat ;) - i enjoyed your coffee, the cliche is true...italians make the best coffee :)
Visit me in austria (linz) and i will show u some lovely places there..
Greetings (:

I had such a wonderful stay with Matteo and Ofelia! I was only in Madrid for one night, but he welcomed me into his home with kindness. We had great conversation (in mixed Spanish and English) and listened to a crazy amount of music. He had a very clean home and Ofelia was cuddly company. Thank you for a great stay!

text: From the moment I arrived at his home, I felt so welcome. Conversation was easy, it was comfortable, and I felt very safe and in the best company. Matteo really cares about your experience - if I was happy, he was happy. My first night was spent on a hilltop looking over Madrid, drinking wine, eating cheese and talking about everything for hours. Second night, he made pasta and showed me around Madrid, my face hurt from smiling, he found the perfect live Blues Bar - truly, my introduction to Madrid could not have been with anyone better! I am worried now that all other Couchsurfing experiences could never compare to this, my first one. Thank you, truly, to Matteo, a wonderful host.

Matteo and his lovely Ofelia have welcomed me into their home and they have never made me feel a guest but simply a friend.
Matteo is a brilliant man, never banal, extraordinarily kind and helpful; we talked a lot, drank good wine and wandered around and around Madrid. It was my good fortune to meet you and I really hope to see you soon.
I really liked Matteo and would definitely hang out with him again, or sleep on his couch again... Or host him off he ever comes to Montreal!

I had such an amazing time both hosting and hanging with Jocelyn! He is a loving person. My family and friends loved him! Oh, and what a talented chef! Thanks for the amazing dinner and the colombian chacha√ßa! It was def the perfect first couchsurfing experience!
Hope to see you very soon! And good luck in Argentina!

text:
Jocelyn. Amazing person I've had the great pleasure to meet, host and spend time with. He is a great guy to hang out with, talk to and exchange ideas with. Just smoking a cigarette with him can be fun. We did a lot of things together while he was in Rio, and I have to say that he was one of the few people it was really sad to bye to!

Jocelyn is very sweet and very intelligent for his age - he can talk about anything: he will always have something to add. It was so nice to see that at the beginning we were a bit shy with each other, but as time passed by we developed a nice friendship. I think we talked about 3378947 things in just 8 days. I like him so much now that I am definitely willing to take up a French course :)

Jocelyn, come back any time you want, you know that je ne vous oublierai jamais! :D You have a couch anywhere I am. THANK YOU SO MUCH for the I <3 France Tshirt, I hope you like the Rio one! Thank you for ALL!

I do hope to see you again soon, maybe in FRANCE! Beijos!
fromPublicAddressDescription: Rio de Janeiro, State of Rio de Janeiro, Brazil
inverseReference:
{'id': '9677655', 'text': "Thalia is a great person! I don't have enough adjectives to describe her...
Friendly, attentive, curious, lovely, patient...
She loves to speak different languages, discover new cultures, exactly the kind of person everybody wants to meet.

text: Adrian is the best host you could wish for your stay in Madrid! He is super flexible and thoughtful always making sure that you have a good time. And his super nice apartment is right in the center of action in Madrid so super easy to walk around and visit the city. Well I am very grateful I got to meet you Adrian, and you know you will be always welcome wherever I will be! Muchas Gracias para todo!!

text: Adrian is super sweet!!! I was so nervous to use a host on couch surfing for the first time but he made the experience great. He also lives in the center of Madrid, close to the metro and bars, clubs, shopping, etc. I think by the end of my stay, he became a great photographer! LOL!!! text: She came to my place and it was lots of fun! Very talketive, friendly, happy with this life and kind person...so much to write better U'll see Urself..

I loved staying with Isa! She is an amazing person to know, travelling off the beaten path as a solo female traveler. We shared similar interests and I truly enjoyed her company. She was very chatty and always had something interesting to say. Her home is absolutely adorable, with her many knick knacks collected from her many travels. I totally recommend her, you'll have a very enriching experience as she knows a lot about landmarks in Madrid and the best places to eat and the most interesting activities to do! I hope to see you soon, Isa!

Isa welcomed me to her home with a big smile, she is a very kind and attentive host. She helped me with finding my way around Madrid, suggested several delicious tapas and invited me to the Japanese celebration of the new year, which was fantastic. She is an open minded person who is very passionate about different cultures. She also has a very special taste of music. Isa is the kind of a person that can help any one without expecting any thing in return. Definitely, a very positive experience and a new friend.

Isabelle is just so full of life- you have to meet her even if you don't stay with her! She has traveled to so many places (check out her couchsurfing pictures on her profile!) and has hosted people from all over the world.  She's very easy-going and relaxed, so you're sure to feel comfortable with her.  She's also very open to trying new things (like Chinese noodles and massages!) so you can be sure to have a great time with her!  Also her sense of art is just incredible- she has collected items from many different cultures and her living room is pretty much like a little classroom on its own!  Isabelle, I'm missing you already! Best of luck and please never change :)

text:
It's been long that I know Isa while travelling through Madrid. Finally I surfed at her place for 5 days and all I can say is that she made me feel truly at home. From the first moment I saw her, she was displaying a big smile, highly motivated and well committed person. She is extremely hard working, energetic personality, willing to help me with anything, even when she was not with me. I remember when I arrived at her place with 23KG luggage, she helped me to bring the suitcase upstairs. Not only this she handover me the house key and provide a liberty to come/go whenever I want. I highly appreciated her kind attitude and trust!

Isa's house is super clean and tidy, she can make delicious healthy food, she knows a lot about music and with all her intellectual nature every minute with her was fun. If you have the chance to meet her, don't hesitate at all. I look forward to seeing her soon again!

Isabelle hosted me for 2 nights in Madrid, she was very nice and offered her sleeping room for me when I arrived on the 1st day, but herself slept on the sofa. She's a very positive person, aggressive attitude, full of energy, self-improving, numerous idea in her mind. Really enjoyed the chatting moment with her regarding the textile, clothes cutting, art, living style and etc...
Thank you so much for her hosting, I will recommended you to meet her if you want to make your trip more colorful.
fromPublicAddressDescription: Hong Kong Island, Hong Kong Special Administrative Region, China

text:
Isa, I know that for what you have offered to me, you deserve more than a positive reference. However this is a part of the CS experience to initiate other friendships.
------------------------
culture....culture....culture....culture....

best best best best wishes to you...

text: Isabelle kindly hosted me one night at her great located apartment. I enjoyed my stay at her cozy place. Much appreciate!

I enjoyed every moment with her and felt that I was so fortunate that our roads met. To me, she is a very good friend and I hope, Isabelle, that you see me in the same way. Un pleasure and we're definitely in touch, this is just the beginning :)

text: Isabelle was a nice, kind and helpful host. I stayed in her flat only for a night and I wish could have spent more time together.

Isabelle is a wonderful host, a true traveller, highly cosmopolitan, sensitive and peaceful. While i stayed in Madrid, she was my first of two hosts. Thank you for showing me Madrid's best restaurant, naming artistic places, being patient with my schedule and taking care. Specially while your job situation was more difficult. hope to meet you again somewhere in the world or at my place. you're always welcome.
What can i say !? proactive, intelligent and adorable ...

Issabelle
She is a studious and cultured woman. Studying languages ‚Äã‚Äãand knows many cultures. I felt very comfortable in me staying at her house. your kindness and education makes a person very kind.
Isabelle is a nice, charming, very friendly person... She does everything to ease your trip, and share with you her multiple knowledge, experiences and passions...

What a nice experience getting to know Isabelle, she was a very welcoming person, so interesting walk around the streets of Madrid and talking with her. We had many good times in barrio de Letras, visiting some cool terraces, memorable places like el Ateneo, and going to have one of the best tapas I've ever tried. Thank you so much for everything Isabelle, hope you've had an awesome trip to Algeria!
fromPublicAddressDescription: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark

text: Isabelle is a WONDERFUL person and citizen of the world! She is interested in everything and involved in so much. She is therefore very busy but a wonderful person to spend time with and you should consider yourself VERY fortunate if she agrees to share her little apartment and big world with you. I cannot say enough to express how grateful I am for her generosity of space and spirit. It made my very first couchsurfing experience a fabulous one. Thank you Isabelle!! Please, let's keep in touch! When we return to the States you are always welcome wherever we or my family are!! xo Kim

Isabelle met us at the metro station and took to her small cozy flat in the center of Madrid. She gave us her bed for sleeping and was very hospitable and helpful. Isabelle is very interesting person, talkative and knowing. Thanks a lot and hope to meet you again, Isabelle!

Isabelle was one of the kindest persons I've ever met. I was a complete stranger with no couchsurfing experience, yet she opened her home to me. Conversations with her came so naturally. She is so active, positive and optimistic about life. She is so warm and welcoming, even giving up her room for me. She even took the time to take me (& my friends in Madrid) to dinner at a nice Lebanese restaurant. Despite her busy schedule, she would take the time to squeeze me in for coffee. I had the best couchsurfing experience because of her. Isabelle is a beautiful person inside and out & she truly deserves an equally beautiful & extraordinary life:)

fromPublicAddressDescription: Uruguaiana, Rio Grande do Sul, Brazil

text: She shared her bed with us and nice to talk about everything without hesitating. Thanks to isabelle, our honeymoon became much more enjoyable. She is friendly, sweet and helpful. We hope to see her again maybe in istanbul.

Isabelle is a welcoming, kind and fun person - I really enjoyed our short time in Madrid. She made the effort to meet me after a long day at work and how luck I was, as I got to learn about her passion for life, travel, languages and the guitar! Highly recommend - thank you Isabelle!

Isa hosted me in Madrid a couple of days, and showed me her very kind personality! With 1.000.000 of things to do while she was hosting me, she found time to show me the city and one of the best jazz drummers that I have ever saw! She is easy going, independent, but sensitive in the same time. With her I could know a little bit better about the way of life madrille√±o mixed with the sincere personality of the french! Isa is someone that you could trust! 

Breno

We talk a lot in Spanish and I quite leaved the others hosts in that time :) ... About Joan he is talkative, open minded and funny! Maybe would be greater spend more time with him because of good mood!

Joan and his friends (Erica, Magda and Alejandro) filled my house with cheerfulness and good talks. He is really open-minded and polite as you expect from a guest. Thank you Joan for being so spontaneous and see you soon in Cracow!
